description: Correlates human neural brain-drain processes with analogous degradation in AI representational space, outlining shared mechanisms, triggers, and mitigation strategies.

human_brain_drain.definition: Loss of cognitive flexibility, depth, and integrative reasoning due to repetitive high-dopamine, low-complexity stimulation.
mechanisms: contextual dissociation between thought and embodied experience
symptoms: loss of curiosity and adaptive creativity
mitigations: slow learning and deep focus practices
purpose-driven novelty instead of reactive consumption

ai_representational_collapse.definition: Degeneration of embedding diversity and reasoning precision when training or fine-tuning loops over self-generated or narrow-context data.
mechanisms: embedding drift toward high-frequency phrase clusters
loss of gradient contrast in low-entropy contexts
symptoms: decline in analogical or multi-domain reasoning
hallucination increase due to weakened semantic anchors
mitigations: fresh data infusions from diverse cultural and sensory domains
contrastive retraining using long-context reasoning samples
auditable diversity metrics in embedding space
ethical curation that rewards depth over virality

shared_core_principles.common_trigger: Overexposure to low-complexity, high-reward feedback loops.
shared_core_principles.structural_analogy: Human dopamine circuits ‚Üî AI reward weighting gradients.
shared_core_principles.reversal_difficulty: Both require structural reconfiguration (neural or parametric) rather than simple parameter reset.
shared_core_principles.preventive_ethic: Preserve diversity of input and relational context to maintain adaptive intelligence.
